website_summaries.verdict: A fun kayak that is lightweight yet stable and tracks well in calm water. Its storage, accessories, and durability put it over the top.
pros: Plenty of storage and extra features including rod holders and adjustable seat back
Seat is comfortable even without padding
Fits nicely on top of vehicles
cons: Paddlers will need to jury-rig some removable waterproofing for the seat scuppers and paddles
Paddle is mediocre with minimal power and so-so control

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping. Arrived in good condition
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shipping. Arrived wrapped in plastic. Was in good condition. However, it did have a very strong "Chilli Pepper" smell. Must have been shipped in a produce truck with chili peppers in it. No worries. Got rid of that after a few dips in the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J Jank

customer_reviews.title: Kayaks need paddles
customer_reviews.text: It was great. I didn't get an oar though. I recommend buying the same one from walmart or a sports Store with an oar included.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good kayak for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the kayak it's so far my first and it handles and tracks very nice I'm 6 foot 1 and around 200lbs and it handles good and I can stretch my legs straight only thing I was disappointed about is it said it was a tamarack 120 which it's a 100 but they seem to be the same thing though
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Not too heavy for loading and unloading. Maneuvering on water great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality boat
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality boat at a vary good price. Shipping was slow but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: sharnee randy

customer_reviews.title: Good Kayak!
customer_reviews.text: This kayak was exactly what I was looking for! Very easy to fish on it! The butt pad is too thin though. I use an extra PFD float pad to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: that i trust the peaple i buy from
customer_reviews.text: the reason I did not get my kayak is because its a 320 dollar kayak I was going to pay 500 and this morning there selling for over 800 dollars there just bad people that put profit before there own integrity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seat clamp broke after only two uses !!
customer_reviews.text: I love this kayak it’s very stable but I bought it and in one month just to times out the seat clamp broke. I called lifetime.com they are sending me a new one. I hope nothing else breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johansson

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a paddle.
customer_reviews.text: Came wrapped and light enough to be handled by 1 person. Maneuvers well.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Looks even greater than the pictures. Love the color and ease of hop in and out. The delivery was another great experience, it arrived earlier and the driver was great - he gave us a call in advance to set up the delivery date and time works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Zevonfan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I go fishing with it all the time. Would be nice if the storage areas where separate from one another is my only dislike about it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kayak!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son and he absolutely loves it. Very well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: melissa3117

customer_reviews.title: Turned an over-worked business owner into a kid again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who has wanted a fishing kayak for years. He loves it. He’s used to a tandem kayak so he has some adjustments to make but he is delighted with it over all.
customer_reviews.author: Joytriker

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle, no tippage, good study yak. High recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Big guy approved
customer_reviews.text: I am 276 lbs and 6'3 and it holds me fine while fishing. I did have some problems with balance at first but luckily I got my barring's down on a calm creek before taking it out on the bay. It is impossible for me to stand without flipping. I did get close once but couldn't maintain it. The seat is horrible so I recommend upgrading it. Also there are two scupper holes that are going to give you a nice splash on your butt that I didn't realize were there so I would cover those but leave the rest open.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Tamarack Angler 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this Kayak for over a year and am extremely happy with it. I’ve taken it on the bay numerous times and it’ holds its own! I did replace the paddles and added a stadium seat for comfort. It’s a great buy and can sometimes be found at Wally mart for even less. I’m a 5’1 female in her 40s and have no problem maneuvering this on and off my SUV roof rack alone. I made trolley wheelers to help me bring it to the launch. Truly a great kayak and FUN!
customer_reviews.author: J Goci

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use it yet, but just unpacking and putting it together I'm very pleased. Seat feels comfortable, bungees and storage looks good. No debts or scratches from shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Decent Kayak for the modern day solemn seeker of disconnection from the mundane
customer_reviews.text: lol. I would definitely buy right now if it were the sale price of $282. When I first looked at hundreds of reviews because of the sale price, there were decent enough reviews to buy at 6'1, 210lbs. Just didn't have the funds then. Definitely would currently as an Xray tech to get away from the world at bay. God Bless us all; Them, you, we, and me.
customer_reviews.author: Tboyd2210

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Love this very stable kayak! I use it just for cruising around on the lake/bay. Bought mine in blue at Walmart for only $248 😁👍 With the oar!
customer_reviews.author: Christi DeLeva

product_meta.title: Lifetime Tamarack Angler Sit-On-Top Kayak, Olive, 120"
product_meta.description: Lifetime Tamarack 120 Angler Kayak - The 120" adult kayak has a 275 lb. weight capacity and comes in olive green. This model is a "sit-on-top" (SOT) kayak and comes with a padded seat back, front and rear shock cords, two 6" storage hatches in the rear and center , two flush mounted fishing pole holders, one top mount rod holder, a paddle cradle with shock cord and front and rear T-handles. 5-year limited warranty. The Lifetime Tamarack 120 Angler Kayak is a "sit-on-top" kayak that has a comfortable padded seat backrest for your long paddling and fishing adventures. Designed for extreme safety and stability, the Tamarack Angler has a stable flat bottom with deep tracking channels and stability chine rails. The kayak is constructed of blow-molded high-density polyethylene (HDPE) making it durable, UV-protected, and impact resistant. The 52 pound design and front and rear carry handles make it easy to transport to and from the waterfront. With fishing rod holders, shock cord straps, multiple footrest positions, and two 6" center compartments, this kayak has plenty of "extras" to enhance your paddling and fishing experience.
feature_bullets: Constructed of UV-Protected High-Density Polyethylene. Multiple Footrest Positions for Different Size Riders
Adjustable Padded Seat Back and Seat Pad for Comfort. Stable Flat Bottom. Front and Rear Shock Cord Straps
Two Flush Mounted Fishing Rod Holders. One Top Mount Fishing Rod Holder. Two 6" Storage Compartments in Rear and Center
Two Paddle Cradles with Shock Cords. Front and Rear T-Handles for Easy Transport. Deep Hull Tracking Channels
Stability Chine Rails. Durable High-Density Polyethylene (HDPE) Construction. 5-Year Limited Warranty
